title: "The Symbolism and Meanings of the Holy Grail"
first_phrase: This text explores the different interpretations and meanings attributed to the Grail. It highlights how the Grail's search is essentially an internal process with a subjective element, and those who can comprehend it are qualified for the high missions it evokes. Prior to discussing the Grail as a stone, the text describes the ambivalent nature of the spear in Irish tradition. It then outlines various interpretations of the mysterious term “lapsit exillîs” associated with the Grail. The piece concludes that all these interpretations are plausible, given the various aspects of the Grail.
content: Este término ha sido interpretado por los estudiosos de varios modos: lapis erilis, es decir: «Piedra del Señor» (San Marte); lapis elixir; refiriéndose al elixir alquímico de la 39 Julius Evola – El Misterio del Grial regeneración (Palgen); lapis betillis o betillus (Hagen), lo que puede remitir a la piedra caída del cielo de la mitología griega; lapis ex coelis o de coelis, «piedra celeste» (Martin) y, por último, «piedra del exilio». En realidad, sea cual sea la exactitud de una u otra de tales interpretaciones conjeturales desde el punto de vista únicamente etimológico, todos ellos son significados posibles para el Grial en sus distintos aspectos.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the interpretation of the term "Grial" has been done in various ways by scholars, but all of them point towards its significance as a precious stone with regenerative properties that was brought down to Earth by a group of angels. Custodied by them and then by a lineage of high knights, the Grial retained its virtues throughout time.
